information: Post Malone has received five nominations for the 60th Academy of Country Music (ACM) Awards, scheduled for May 8, 2025. His nominations include Album of the Year for "F-1 Trillion," and three nominations for his collaboration with Morgan Wallen, "I Had Some Help." He is not nominated for the top category, Entertainer of the Year. Key competitors include first-time nominee Ella Langley, who leads with eight nominations. Other heavily nominated artists are Morgan Wallen and Lainey Wilson with seven nominations each, and Chris Stapleton with six nominations.

forecast.status_quo_outcome: Yes — Post Malone wins at least one ACM award
forecast.no_outcome_scenario: Stronger industry favorites consolidate votes: Lainey Wilson, Chris Stapleton, Zach Bryan or another consensus pick sweep the major song/single/event categories; the collaboration I Had Some Help underperforms across Single/Song/Music Event/Video; and F-1 Trillion loses Album of the Year to a critical/industry favorite. Correlated losses lead to a shutout.
forecast.yes_outcome_scenario: I Had Some Help (with Morgan Wallen) wins Single of the Year or Music Event of the Year (both credit the artist), or F-1 Trillion wins Album of the Year; any one win resolves Yes.
forecast.rationale: Time is short and nominations are set, so the main uncertainty is how ACM voters break in competitive categories. Post Malone reportedly has 4–5 nominations (user says 4; RA report says 5: Album of the Year for F-1 Trillion plus multiple nods for I Had Some Help with Morgan Wallen). Multiple nominations create several paths to at least one win, especially via the blockbuster hit I Had Some Help, which had extraordinary commercial performance and broad cultural reach. Base rate: artists with 4–5 ACM nominations typically win something more often than not. That supports a Yes-leaning status quo. Reasons it’s not higher: outcomes are correlated—if voters are cool toward the Post/Wallen collaboration or toward a pop‑to‑country crossover, it could miss in Single, Song, Music Event, and Video together, and Album could go to a more traditional/critically favored project (e.g., Lainey Wilson, Chris Stapleton, Zach Bryan). Competition is heavy this year, and ACMs can favor established country mainstays. Reasons it’s not lower: even with tough fields, the sheer number of shots plus the strength of I Had Some Help make a complete shutout less likely. What would move me up: credible industry/betting signals favoring I Had Some Help in Single or Music Event; pre-telecast category wins; reports of strong voter enthusiasm for F-1 Trillion. What would move me down: indications that insiders are rallying behind a different single/song, negative eligibility/credit news affecting Malone’s recognition in collaborative categories, or leaked tallies suggesting a sweep by a rival.

prompt:
You are a professional forecaster interviewing for a job.

Your interview question is:
Will Post Malone win an award at the 60th Academy of Country Music Awards?

Question background:
The awards are scheduled to be held on May 8, 2025. Malone has 4 nominations.


This question's outcome will be determined by the specific criteria below. These criteria have not yet been satisfied:
This question resolves as **Yes** if Post Malone wins an award at the [60th Academy of Country Music Awards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/60th_Academy_of_Country_Music_Awards).




Your research assistant's report says:
Post Malone has received five nominations for the 60th Academy of Country Music (ACM) Awards, scheduled for May 8, 2025. His nominations include Album of the Year for "F-1 Trillion," and three nominations for his collaboration with Morgan Wallen, "I Had Some Help." He is not nominated for the top category, Entertainer of the Year. Key competitors include first-time nominee Ella Langley, who leads with eight nominations. Other heavily nominated artists are Morgan Wallen and Lainey Wilson with seven nominations each, and Chris Stapleton with six nominations.

Today is 2025-04-22.

Before answering you think:
(a) The time left until the outcome to the question is known.
(b) The status quo outcome if nothing changed.
(c) A brief description of a scenario that results in a No outcome.
(d) A brief description of a scenario that results in a Yes outcome.
(e) You write your rationale remembering that good forecasters put extra weight on the status quo outcome since the world changes slowly most of the time. Explain your reasoning and the evidence behind your forecast in detail. Summarise information your received from your research assistant that influences your forecast (if any). Explain why your forecast is not higher, and why it is not lower. Outline what would need to be true for you to update your forecast in either direction.
(f) The last thing you write is your final probabilistic forecast as a number between 0 and 100.

# OUTPUT SCHEMA
{
    "time_left_until_outcome_known": "string",
    "status_quo_outcome": "string",
    "no_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "yes_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "rationale": "string",
    "probability": "number" (0-100)
}
